Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type short.
shortValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as a short after a widening primitive conversion.

Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type int.
intValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as an int after a widening primitive conversion.

Returns: the argument converted to int by an unsigned conversion
Parameters: byte: the value to convert to an unsigned int
toUnsignedInt(byte).Description: Converts the argument to an int by an unsigned conversion. In an unsigned conversion to an int, the high-order 24 bits of the int are zero and the low-order 8 bits are equal to the bits of the byte argument. Consequently, zero and positive byte values are mapped to a numerically equal int value and negative byte values are mapped to an int value equal to the input plus 2

valueOf(byte).Description: Returns a Byte instance representing the specified byte value. If a new Byte instance is not required, this method should generally be used in preference to the constructor @B_java#lang#Byte#Byte_E@, as this method is likely to yield significantly better space and time performance since all byte values are cached.

Returns: the string representation of the specified byte
Parameters: byte: the byte to be converted
toString(byte).Description: Returns a new String object representing the specified byte. The radix is assumed to be 10.

Returns: the value 0 if x == y; a value less than 0 if x < y; and a value greater than 0 if x > y
Parameters: byte: the first byte to compare
byte: the second byte to compare
compare(byte, byte).Description: Compares two byte values numerically. The value returned is identical to what would be returned by:
compare(byte, byte).FullName: public static int compare (byte x, byte y)

Returns: the argument converted to long by an unsigned conversion
Parameters: byte: the value to convert to an unsigned long
toUnsignedLong(byte).Description: Converts the argument to a long by an unsigned conversion. In an unsigned conversion to a long, the high-order 56 bits of the long are zero and the low-order 8 bits are equal to the bits of the byte argument. Consequently, zero and positive byte values are mapped to a numerically equal long value and negative byte values are mapped to a long value equal to the input plus 2

Returns: a Byte object holding the byte value represented by nm
Throws: if the String does not contain a parsable byte.
decode(java.lang.String).Description: Decodes a String into a Byte. Accepts decimal, hexadecimal, and octal numbers given by the following grammar: The sequence of characters following an optional sign and/or radix specifier ("0x", "0X", "#", or leading zero) is parsed as by the Byte.parseByte method with the indicated radix (10, 16, or 8). This sequence of characters must represent a positive value or a @B_java#lang#NumberFormatException_E@ will be thrown. The result is negated if first character of the specified String is the minus sign. No whitespace characters are permitted in the String.

Returns: the byte value represented by the string argument in the specified radix
Parameters: String: the String containing the byte representation to be parsed
int: the radix to be used while parsing s
Throws: If the string does not contain a parsable byte.
parseByte(java.lang.String,int).Description: Parses the string argument as a signed byte in the radix specified by the second argument. The characters in the string must all be digits, of the specified radix (as determined by whether @B_java#lang#Character#digit_E@ returns a nonnegative value) except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('\u002D') to indicate a negative value or an ASCII plus sign '+' ('\u002B') to indicate a positive value. The resulting byte value is returned. An exception of type NumberFormatException is thrown if any of the following situations occurs: The first argument is null or is a string of length zero. The radix is either smaller than @B_java#lang#Character#MIN_RADIX_E@ or larger than @B_java#lang#Character#MAX_RADIX_E@. Any character of the string is not a digit of the specified radix, except that the first character may be a minus sign '-' ('\u002D') or plus sign '+' ('\u002B') provided that the string is longer than length 1. The value represented by the string is not a value of type byte.
parseByte(java.lang.String,int).FullName: public static byte parseByte (String s, int radix)

Returns: a Byte object holding the value represented by the string argument in the specified radix.
Parameters: String: the string to be parsed
int: the radix to be used in interpreting s
Throws: If the String does not contain a parsable byte.
valueOf(java.lang.String, int).Description: Returns a Byte object holding the value extracted from the specified String when parsed with the radix given by the second argument. The first argument is interpreted as representing a signed byte in the radix specified by the second argument, exactly as if the argument were given to the @B_java#lang#Byte#parseByte_E@ method. The result is a Byte object that represents the byte value specified by the string. In other words, this method returns a Byte object equal to the value of:
valueOf(java.lang.String, int).FullName: public static Byte valueOf (String s, int radix)

Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type double.
doubleValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as a double after a widening primitive conversion.

Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type long.
longValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as a long after a widening primitive conversion.

Returns: true if the objects are the same; false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the object to compare with
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares this object to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a Byte object that contains the same byte value as this object.

Returns: the byte value represented by the argument in decimal
Parameters: String: a String containing the byte representation to be parsed
Throws: if the string does not contain a parsable byte.
parseByte(java.lang.String).Description: Parses the string argument as a signed decimal byte. The characters in the string must all be decimal digits, except that the first character may be an ASCII minus sign '-' ('\u002D') to indicate a negative value or an ASCII plus sign '+' ('\u002B') to indicate a positive value. The resulting byte value is returned, exactly as if the argument and the radix 10 were given as arguments to the @B_java#lang#Byte#parseByte_E@ method.

Returns: a hash code value for a byte value.
hashCode(byte).Description: Returns a hash code for a byte value; compatible with Byte.hashCode().

Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type byte.
byteValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as a byte.

Returns: the value 0 if this Byte is equal to the argument Byte; a value less than 0 if this Byte is numerically less than the argument Byte; and a value greater than 0 if this Byte is numerically greater than the argument Byte (signed comparison).
Parameters: Byte: the Byte to be compared.
String: the String to be converted to a Byte
Throws: If the String does not contain a parsable byte.
Byte(java.lang.String).Description: Constructs a newly allocated Byte object that represents the byte value indicated by the String parameter. The string is converted to a byte value in exactly the manner used by the parseByte method for radix 10.

Returns: the numeric value represented by this object after conversion to type float.
floatValue().Description: Returns the value of this Byte as a float after a widening primitive conversion.

Returns: a string representation of the value of this object in base 10.
toString().Description: Returns a String object representing this Byte's value. The value is converted to signed decimal representation and returned as a string, exactly as if the byte value were given as an argument to the @B_java#lang#Byte#toString_E@ method.

The resulting byte value is returned. An exception of type NumberFormatException is thrown if any of the following situations occurs: The first argument is null or is a string of length zero. The radix is either smaller than @B_java#lang#Character#MIN_RADIX_E@ or larger than @B_java#lang#Character#MAX_RADIX_E@. Any character of the string is not a digit of the specified radix, except that the first character may be a minus sign '-' ('\u002D') or plus sign '+' ('\u002B') provided that the string is longer than length 1. ClassDesc: The Byte class wraps a value of primitive type byte in an object. An object of type Byte contains a single field whose type is byte. In addition, this class provides several methods for converting a byte to a String and a String to a byte, as well as other constants and methods useful when dealing with a byte.
